bibl.title: In the matter of James A. Balch on Habeas Corpus Proceedings. Complaint and Commitment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Puget Sound Regional Branch

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington

div1.p: TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON, County of Yakima In the matter of an insane person

David Guilland, being duly sworn, on oath, says there is in said county an insane (idiotic) person, whose name is James A. Balch, who, by reason of insanity (or idiocy ), is unsafe to be at large (or is suffering under mental derangement) ; and affiant therefore asks that said person be arrested and taken before a Judge of Probate within said county for examination.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 2nd day of June A.D. 1883 J.A. Navarre, Probate Judge.

James A. Balch the person named in the foregoing affidavit, being this day brought before me, Judge of the Probate Court Yakima county, for examination on a charge of insanity, and no jury being demanded either by him or by anyone in his behalf, and having heard the testimony of David Guilland and in Yakima Citywitnesses who has been acquinted with the accused during the time of the alleged insanity; and Drs. W. F. Morrison and J. O. Clark who respectable and legally qualified physicians, after hearing the testimony of witnesses, after a personal examination of the accused, having made the certificate by law required; and being myself satisfied that the said James A. Balch is insane (or idiotic) and being further satisfied of the truth of all the matters set forth in the certificate of said Physicians, I do hereby order the said James A. Balch to be confined in the Hospital for the Insane at Fort Steilacoom, and the Sheriff of this county is charged with the execution of this order.
The seal of the said probate court Witness my hand and seal this 2nd day of June 1883 James A. Navarre Probate Judge of Yakima County W.T.

figure.p: Yakima County W. T. Probate Court

div1.p: FORM TO BE USED IN CASE A JURY IS DEMANDED.

, the person named in the foregoing affidavit being this day broguht before me, Judge of the Probate Court of County, for examination on a charge of insanity, and a trail by jury being demanded by , a jury was thereupon duly impaneled. The said jury, having heard the testimony of and , witnesses who have been acquainted with the accused during the time of the alleged insanity, and Drs. and legally qualified physicians, having made the certificate by law required, after due consideration rendered a verdict of insanity, as charged in the complaint. The said have been declared insane,...he is hereby ordered to be confined in the Hospital for the Insane at Fort Steilacoom, and the Sheriff of this county is charged with the execution of this order. Witness my hand and seal this day of 188 Probate Judge of County, W. T.

After inquiry as by law required, I find the said James A. Balch, is unable to pay his expenses in the hospital at the rate of forty five 00/100 Dollars for over two months, he has relatives who - viz (see code sec. 1632, 1655, 2697-8) have some property in Klickilat County and he has a wife Mrs. Hattie M. Balch in Lyle Klickilat Co. W.T. Whereas my hand and seal this 2nd day of June 1883 Seal of the Probate Court Yakima Co.
Copy of order of COMMITMENT of James A Balch of Yakima County to the HOSPITAL + FOR + THE + INSANE, AT FORT STEILACOOM, Washington Territory

p.del: I hereby certify that the within are true and correct copies of the original Complaint, Physicians Certificate and Commitment in the matter of . . . . . an insane (or idiotic) person, this day committed by me to the Hospital for the Insane of Washington Territory.
